content: From May 1st, the government has opened several vaccination centers for people aged between 18 to 45. As the vaccines are scarce and logging in every time to check status is a cumbersome process, I have used open APIs provided by the government to keep track of the availability of vaccines. Warning This post is a work in progress! A more detailed post coming soon.
title: Covid Vaccine Availability Dashboard

content: Cowin APIs in Python import requests import json # Appointment availibility by district and date (18+) url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/appointment/sessions/public/findByDistrict" params = {"district_id": "365", "date": "07-05-2021"} response = requests.get(url, params=params) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) data = response.json() for session in data["sessions"]: if session["min_age_limit"] == 18: print(json.dumps(session, indent=2)) # Appointment availibility by district for (18+) for next 7 days url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/appointment/sessions/public/calendarByDistrict" params = {"district_id": "365", "date": "07-05-2021"} response = requests.get(url, params=params) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) data = response.json() for center in data["centers"]: for session in center["sessions"]: if session["min_age_limit"] == 18 and session["vaccine"]=="COVISHIELD" and session["available_capacity"] > 0: print(json.dumps(session, indent=2)) # API for state and district lists url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/admin/location/states" response = requests.get(url) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) print(json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2)) state_id = "21" url = "https://cdn-api.co-vin.in/api/v2/admin/location/districts/" + state_id response = requests.get(url) print("HTTP ", response.status_code) print(json.dumps(response.json(), indent=2))
